Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; complex floral on left in added white and red, with spiral in faded white outline; on right part of possible palmette with alternating red and white petals; exterior: forelegs of animal to right with elaborate rosette as filling ornament underneath.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as coming from a light-walled and big chalice belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice kraters. Chalices in this group display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 90, p. 261, no. 520)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0480) (phase 2)
